questions.question: What is psychology?
options: The study of physical health and exercise.
The analysis of weather patterns and their effects.
The branch of science that studies how the brain works and how the mind influences behavior in people and animals.
The study of ancient artifacts and cultures.

questions.question: What makes us choose one choice over the other?
How is the brain the control system of the body?
options: It stores all nutrients and energy for the body.
It processes food and nutrients for the body.
The brain receives signals from the rest of the body & makes sense of them.

questions.question: What does the cerebrum do?
options: Helps us interpret the world around us with memory, vision, hearing, and our senses.
Regulates heart rate and blood pressure.

questions.question: What does the cerebellum do?
options: Conducts motor functions like muscle movement & balance.

questions.question: What does the brain stem do?
options: Conducts necessary functions like breathing, heart rate, etc.

questions.question: What did Freudian Psychology emphasize?
options: That the brain controls only physical movements.
That all our actions are based on the weather.
That our actions and behaviors are shaped by past experiences and unconscious thoughts.
That our brain works best during sleep.

questions.question: What makes us fall for mind tricks?
options: Speed of Processing and Selective Attention Theory.

questions.question: How do you make a short term memory?
options: Feel/See something and have it registered in your brain.

questions.question: How long can memories stay in short term memory for?
What animal was the hippocampus named after?
What makes a memory long term?
options: Experiencing the memory more than once.
Reading about it in a book.

questions.question: What is memory fading?
options: When you stop reviewing the memory, it fades from your memory and gets replaced.
When memories get stronger over time.
When memories become more vivid and detailed.
When new memories are created quickly.

questions.question: What is targeted forgetting?
options: Learn new information that is different to old information and 'Delete' old information while you sleep.
Forgetting all information from the past month.

questions.question: Why is the nervous system important in how we respond to the world?
options: It allows your body to send and receive messages to and from the brain

questions.question: Why was the hippocampus named after a seahorse?
options: Because it helps humans swim like a seahorse.
Because scientists wanted to name it after a sea creature.
Because the shape of the hippocampus looks like a seahorse.

questions.question: What part of the brain is responsible for memory storage?
Why is studying psychology important?
options: It helps you become a faster reader and memorize historical dates.
It helps you understand yourself and others, manage emotions, and explore careers like therapy and research.
It teaches you how to build machines and code computers.
It focuses only on solving math equations and physical health.

questions.question: What is selective attention?
options: Focusing on one thing while ignoring others

questions.question: Which of the following is a strategy to help remember information better?
options: Memorize words in random order only.
Convert words into pictures, create stories, or group related information together.
Try to memorize only one word at a time without context.
